title: 112_hr3342
content: The Act titled "Affordable Medicines Utilization Act of 2011" allows for savings rebate for states that increase generic drug utilization under Medicaid. The Affordable Medicines Utilization Act of 2011 provides a savings rebate for states that increase generic drug utilization under Medicaid. Section 1903 of the Social Security Act is amended to increase the amount determined for a state if their generic substitution rate exceeds previous years. The Affordable Medicines Utilization Act of 2011 offers a savings rebate for states that boost generic drug usage in Medicaid. Section 1927 of the Social Security Act is amended to determine the difference in state expenditures for multiple source drugs and the state percentage for generic substitution rates annually. The Secretary will annually determine generic substitution rates for each State and publish the rates on the CMS website, listing States in order of the greatest increase in generic substitution rate. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will evaluate and report to Congress on the effectiveness of generic drug utilization savings payments in encouraging States to increase their generic substitution rates. The Secretary of Health and Human Services will evaluate the effectiveness of generic drug utilization savings payments in encouraging States to increase their Medicaid generic substitution rate. The evaluation will analyze the savings to State Medicaid programs, indirect savings through medication adherence, and future estimated savings after termination of the savings payments. The term "Medicaid generic substitution rate" is defined as the generic substitution rate under section 1927(l)(2) of the Social Security Act. SEC. 3. INNOVATIVE HEALTH CARE SAVINGS PROGRAM. The Innovative Health Care Savings Program amends Section 1903 of the Social Security Act to provide payments to eligible States for implementing programs to reduce expenditures under title XVIII. States must achieve a generic substitution rate of at least 92 percent to be eligible for these payments, which can only be used for expenditure reduction programs. The program provides payments to States for cost-saving initiatives under title XVIII, with specific application and funding limitations set by the Secretary. The program provides payments to States for cost-saving initiatives under title XVIII, with funding limitations set by the Secretary. Payment allocation among eligible States is determined by the Secretary, and payments are made in the same manner as other payments under section. The amendment made by subsection (a) is effective for quarters beginning on or after the date of enactment of this Act.
